# 5.0 Docs

> Documentation for 5.0 Docs.

- [Breaking change: BinaryFormatter.Deserialize rewraps some exceptions](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/binaryformatter-deserialize-rewraps-exceptions.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where BinaryFormatter.Deserialize rewraps some exception objects inside a SerializationException.
- [Breaking change: BinaryFormatter serialization methods are obsolete and prohibited in ASP.NET apps](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/binaryformatter-serialization-obsolete.md): Learn about the .NET 5 breaking change in core .NET libraries where serialize and deserialize methods on BinaryFormatter, Formatter, and IFormatter are obsolete.
- [Breaking change: Deserialize char requires single-character string](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/deserializing-json-into-char-requires-single-character.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where System.Text.Json requires a single-char string in the JSON when deserializing to a char target.
- [Breaking change: ASP.NET Core apps allow deserializing quoted numbers](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/jsonserializer-allows-reading-numbers-as-strings.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where ASP.NET Core apps will successfully deserialize numbers that are represented as JSON strings instead of throwing an exception.
- [Breaking change: Serialize throws exception when type parameter is null](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/jsonserializer-serialize-throws-argumentnullexception-for-null-type.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where JsonSerialize serialization methods that have a Type parameter now throw an exception whenever null is passed for that parameter.
- [Breaking change: Non-public, parameterless constructors not used for deserialization](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/non-public-parameterless-constructors-not-used-for-deserialization.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where non-public, parameterless constructors are no longer used for deserialization with JsonSerializer.
- [Breaking change: PropertyNamingPolicy, PropertyNameCaseInsensitive, and Encoder options are honored for key-value pairs](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dotnet/docs/refs/heads/llmstxt/docs/core/compatibility/serialization/5.0/options-honored-when-serializing-key-value-pairs.md): Learn about the breaking change in .NET 5 where the PropertyNamingPolicy, PropertyNameCaseInsensitive, and Encoder options are honored when serializing and deserializing the Key and Value property names of a key-value pair instance.
